                          • +
                          Robbz Nick Price • a month ago

                          For me this code works:



                          $(window).resize(function() {
                          console.log("Unslick!");

                          $('.imagelist').slick("unslick");
                          $('.imagelist').hide(); // optionally
                          $('.imagelist .image').removeAttr("aria-describedby role tabindex style");

                          window.setTimeout(function(){
                          // console.log("Re-slick", slickOptions);
                          $('.imagelist').show(); // optionally
                          $('.imagelist').slick(slickOptions);
                          }, 200); // can be changed to a lower value - whatever works

                          });

                          I unslick the slider, wait 200ms and then "re-slick" it, but it is important to remove the attributes on the images first.

                              • +
                              Murray Chapman Nick Price • 2 months ago

                              This could be handled with jQuery. By adding an .resize to the Window object.

                              $( window ).resize(function() {
                              $( "#slideshow-div-Name" ).slick();
                              });

                              I used this once and it cause the slideshow to jagger for a split second but corrected the slideshow.

                              Also realise that sometimes this can be a browser window object and how it handles passing browser window resizing into the page object for the scripts to trigger when detected. It may be worth checking this on multiple browsers just to make sure.

                              Cheers

                                          John Shaw • 3 years ago

                                          Hi there Ken, Love the slider

                                          In Wordpress, I've implemented Slick-slider using ACF pro. But it's not working very well: basically for a split second the slides all load one on top of the other at first.

                                          I think this must be some sort of conflict as even if I remove the images the blank slides still load one on top of the other.

                                          I've also gone through the plugins and turned them off with no change.

                                          The images are loaded as inline background image and then CSS and media queries control the style.

                                          This is a dev site: http://renfrewshirechamber....

                                          This is the code in the template:






                                          <div class="homepage-slider">



                                              

                                          	<div class="container bg-image slide" style="background-image:url(&lt;?php the_sub_field('background_image'); ?&gt;);">

                                          		<div class="overlay"></div>

                                          		<div class="section group wrap">

                                          			<section class="main-message box bg-transpurple col span_4_of_12 on-purple">

                                          				<h1 class="subhead"></h1>

                                          				


                                          				


                                          			</section>

                                          		</div>

                                          	</div>

                                          	



                                          </div>

                                          This is the JS settings:


                                              // Homepage slider

                                              

                                              jQuery('.homepage-slider').slick({

                                                  slide: 'div',

                                                  autoplay: true,

                                                  autoplaySpeed: 5000,

                                                  arrows: true,

                                                  lazyLoad: 'ondemand',

                                                  fade: true

                                              });

                                          If anyone has any ideas why it's happening it would be much appreciated

                                          Thanks
                                          John

                                              • +
                                              Christoph Kaun John Shaw • 3 years ago

                                              Couldn't find your script in which you initialize the slider but just by looking at your site I think the problem is that you load a lot of stuff. It took my browser ~4 seconds to load your site. When using $(document).ready(....); in your script the script will executed after the DOM is loaded.
                                              So the larger your website, the longer the slider will not be initialized. And thats why your images show on top of each other for some time

                                                                    sha DAMR • 2 years ago

                                                                    cool, but the content become unresponsive to screen size. any idea why?

                                                                      see more
                                                                    • 1
                                                                    • •

                                                                        • −
                                                                        • +
                                                                        Johnathan Snowman sha • 2 years ago

                                                                        That's because the person asking this question is looking to set the width to a static size, which would naturally make it unresponsive.

                                                                        You might be looking to use max-width: in the CSS instead of width: to provide a maximum size and then have it scale down if the content gets smaller, but what you're asking is a pretty core concept of responsive design, so I'd suggest diving into learning that a little deeper if you need something more complicated.

                                                                                Евгений Гринец Johnathan Snowman • a year ago

                                                                                Well, I'll add myself: becouse we have .slick-track with width: 20000px as nearest parent of ".slick-slide" and ".slick-slide img", percentage have no results, we need to use viewport width:

                                                                                .slick-slide img {
                                                                                max-width: 100vw;
                                                                                }

                                                                                                          • +
                                                                                                          Dan Swain DAMR • 3 months ago

                                                                                                          In addition to setting variableWidth: true, instead of .slick-slide{ width: 270px;} you should use .slick-slide img {margin-right: 25px} (or whatever you want your right margin to be). This will ensure the same amount of space between images no matter what the width of each image is. Just setting a hard width value basically overrides the intention of variableWidth: true.

                                                                                                            see more

                                                                                                                                      • +
                                                                                                                                      Dennis • 5 years ago

                                                                                                                                      hi,

                                                                                                                                      thank you for this slider. its dynamic functionality with responsiveness is really great. but there is one feauture i missed and so i implemented it by myself. maybe you want to add it in a future release. it is "adaptiveHeight" - e.g. the bxslider has this feature.

                                                                                                                                      i wrote an additional prototype and hope this is an inspiration for you to add this functionality. i think its far away from "perfect", but for me it works.
                                                                                                                                      1) i do a children loop to find all slide elements of the slick slider
                                                                                                                                      2) i get the heights of all currently/next visible elements and get the maximum height
                                                                                                                                      3) i do a jquery animate of the heights of .slick-list and .slick-track

                                                                                                                                      my code is:

                                                                                                                                      Slick.prototype.updateAdaptiveHeight = function() {

                                                                                                                                              var _ = this;
                                                                                                                                      		
                                                                                                                                      	if (_.options.adaptiveHeight === true) {
                                                                                                                                      		var first_slide 	= _.currentSlide;
                                                                                                                                      		var last_slide 		= _.currentSlide + _.options.slidesToScroll;
                                                                                                                                      		if(last_slide > _.slideCount) {
                                                                                                                                      				last_slide 		= _.slideCount;
                                                                                                                                      				first_slide		= last_slide - _.options.slidesToScroll;
                                                                                                                                      		}
                                                                                                                                      			
                                                                                                                                      		var final_h = 0;
                                                                                                                                      		var i_item = 0;
                                                                                                                                      		_.$slider.find(".slick-track").children(_.options.slide + ":not(.slick-cloned)").each(function() {
                                                                                                                                      				if(i_item >= first_slide && i_item < last_slide) {
                                                                                                                                      					var h = $(this).outerHeight();
                                                                                                                                      					
                                                                                                                                      					if(h > final_h) {
                                                                                                                                      						final_h = h;
                                                                                                                                      					}
                                                                                                                                      					
                                                                                                                                      				}
                                                                                                                                      				
                                                                                                                                      				i_item++;
                                                                                                                                      			});
                                                                                                                                      			
                                                                                                                                      		_.$slider.find(".slick-list, .slick-track")
                                                                                                                                      				.animate({
                                                                                                                                      						height: final_h + "px"
                                                                                                                                      				}, _.options.speed);
                                                                                                                                              }
                                                                                                                                          };

                                                                                                                                        see more

                                                                                                                                                  • +
                                                                                                                                                  Chris Howard boris • 5 years ago

                                                                                                                                                  Boris,

                                                                                                                                                  This is what I'm using. Works in my usages. Haven't tested it with different box models. I always use: box-sizing:border-box;.

                                                                                                                                                    var afterChange = function(slider,i) {
                                                                                                                                                      var slideHeight = jQuery(slider.$slides[i] ).height();
                                                                                                                                                      jQuery(slider.$slider ).height( slideHeight);
                                                                                                                                                    };

                                                                                                                                                  To use it, add:

                                                                                                                                                    onAfterChange: afterChange


                                                                                                                                                  to your slider settings.

                                                                                                                                                    see more
                                                                                                                                                  • 5
